Package com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.wire

Interface SidedFaceBlockNode

All Superinterfaces:
BlockNode, SidedBlockNode
public interface SidedFaceBlockNode extends SidedBlockNode
A block node that occupies a side of a block and can connect to center-wire block nodes, like a SidedWireBlockNode, but that cannot connect to other sided block nodes.

  • Method Details

    • canConnect

      default boolean canConnect(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.Direction inDirection, @NotNull @NotNull HalfLink link)
      Checks whether this sided face block node can connect to the given other block node.
      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder and context.
      inDirection - the direction that the other node is connecting from.
      link - the link to the other block node.
      Returns:
      true if a connection should be allowed to form, false otherwise.

    • findConnections

      @NotNull default @NotNull Collection<HalfLink> findConnections(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self)
      Default find connections implementation.

      This makes use of WireConnectionDiscoverers.sidedFaceFindConnections(SidedFaceBlockNode, NodeHolder).

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder, holding the context of this node.
      Returns:
